citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Geological Survey of Japan reconnaissance map, 1900

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1900 paper map set entitled: Geological Survey of Japan reconnaissance map. This map consists of five sheets, although sheets 2 and 5 are missing from this set, the online linkage file contains a polygon layer that serves an index for the other three sheets. To download the map sheets using this index in ArcMap, add the layer, open the layer properties dialog, select the display tab, and check the "support hyperlinks using field" box while selecting the URL field in the dropdown menu. Then use the hyperlinks tool to select the polygon representing the desired tile. These map sheets were scanned at 300 dots per inch and are in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. These images may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 map on 5 sheets : col. ; 551 x 73 cm., sheets 84 x 121 cm. Scale 1:400,000 ; Flamsteed's modified proj. Relief shown by contours and spot heights. Includes magnetic observations. Engraved by S. Takenouchi ... [et al.]. Includes 5 insets. Sheets called Divisions I-V.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.
